question:
Consider the following international conventions that were frequently making in news:
  1. UN Convention against Torture (CAT)
  2. Minamata Convention
  3. United Nations Convention against Corruption
  4. Budapest Treaty
Which of the above has/have been ratified by India?
explanation: The Minamata Convention on Mercury is an international treaty designed to protect human health and the environment from anthropogenic emissions and releases of mercury and mercury compounds. The convention has come into force from August 16, 2017. India has signed the treaty in 2014 but still has not ratified the treaty. The United Nations Convention against Corruption (UNCAC) is a multilateral treaty negotiated by member states of the United Nations (UN) and promoted by the UN Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC). India has ratified the United Nations Convention against Corruption in 2011. The Budapest Treaty is an international treaty signed in Budapest, Hungary, on April 28, 1977. The treaty is administered by the World Intellectual Property Organization (WIPO). India is member of this treaty with effect from December 17, 2001. The treaty allows deposits of microorganisms at an international depository authority to be recognised for the purposes of patent procedure. Patent, Trademark, Copyright and Designs are most commonly recognised IPRs in India. If any kind of invention the country uses biological material and it is not already known, then India has to submit it at the International Depository Authority before applying for the patent. United Nations Convention against Torture (UNCAT) is an international human rights treaty, to prevent torture and other acts of cruel, inhuman, or degrading treatment or punishment around the world. India has signed the treaty but not ratified it yet.
